meanings.definition: A piece of land held by a tenant.
meanings.sent1: The small farm was one of the tenantries in the village.
meanings.sent2: The landlord had many tenantries scattered across the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The tenantries in the area were so lush that even the cows seemed happy.
meanings.sent4: Her tenantries were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly into the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers blooming on the tenantries painted a beautiful picture.

meanings.definition: The act of holding or occupying land as a tenant.
meanings.sent1: His tenantries required regular maintenance to keep them productive.
meanings.sent2: The tenantries were passed down through generations in his family.
meanings.sent3: The tenantries seemed to have a mind of their own, always needing attention.
meanings.sent4: She juggled her tenantries with grace, never missing a beat.
meanings.sent5: The tenantries whispered stories of the past to those who cared to listen.
